practiceSets.title: OPIc Novice Mid - Novice High - Personal Background Practice 1

questions.prompt: Tell me about yourself. What's your name and where are you from?
tips: Take your time to think before speaking
It's okay to make small mistakes
Focus on communicating your main idea

questions.prompt: Describe your family. How many people are in your family?
tips: Take your time to think before speaking
It's okay to make small mistakes
Focus on communicating your main idea

questions.prompt: What do you do? Are you a student or do you work?

Focus on communicating your main idea

questions.prompt: Tell me about where you live. Do you live in a house or an apartment?
tips: Take your time to think before speaking

Focus on communicating your main idea

questions.prompt: What languages do you speak? Which language do you speak best?
tips: Take your time to think before speaking
It's okay to make small mistakes

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate Low - Intermediate Mid - Past Experiences Practice 1

questions.prompt: Tell me about a memorable vacation you took. Where did you go and what did you do?
Describe a time when you moved to a new place. How did you feel about it?
Think about a special celebration or holiday from your childhood. What made it memorable?
Tell me about a time when you tried something new. What was it and how did it go?
Describe a memorable meal you had. Where was it and who were you with?

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate Low - Intermediate Mid - Comparing Past and Present Practice 2

questions.prompt: How has your neighborhood changed since you were a child?
Compare how you spent your free time in the past versus now.
How has technology changed the way people communicate compared to 10 years ago?
Think about your eating habits. How have they changed over the years?
Compare your current job or studies with what you did in the past.

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate Low - Intermediate Mid - Personal Preferences Practice 3

questions.prompt: What type of movies do you prefer and why? Give me some examples.
Describe your ideal vacation. Where would you go and what would you do?
What kind of music do you like? How does it make you feel?
Tell me about your favorite restaurant. What makes it special?
What's your preferred way to exercise or stay healthy? Explain why.

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate High - Advanced Low - Problem Solving Practice 1

questions.prompt: Imagine you're planning a surprise party for a friend, but the venue cancels last minute. What would you do to solve this problem?
Your coworker keeps interrupting you during meetings. How would you handle this situation diplomatically?
You're traveling abroad and lose your passport. Walk me through the steps you would take to resolve this.
A friend asks to borrow money, but they haven't returned money they borrowed before. How would you respond?
You're assigned to work on a group project with someone who isn't contributing. What would you do?

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate High - Advanced Low - Hypothetical Situations Practice 2

questions.prompt: If you could change one thing about your city's transportation system, what would it be and why?
Imagine you won a large amount of money in the lottery. What would you do with it?
If you could have dinner with any three people, living or dead, who would you choose and why?
Suppose your best friend was considering dropping out of school. What advice would you give them?
If you could go back in time and change one decision you made, what would it be?

practiceSets.title: OPIc Intermediate High - Advanced Low - Abstract Topics Practice 3

questions.prompt: What role does technology play in modern education? Discuss both positive and negative aspects.
How important is work-life balance in today's society? Share your perspective.
What are the advantages and disadvantages of social media for young people?
How has globalization affected traditional cultures? Give your opinion with examples.
Discuss the importance of environmental protection. What can individuals do to help?

practiceSets.title: OPIc Advanced Mid - Advanced High - Complex Argumentation Practice 1

questions.prompt: Some people believe that artificial intelligence will eventually replace most human jobs, while others think it will create new opportunities. What's your position on this debate?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: There's ongoing discussion about whether university education should be free for everyone. Present arguments for both sides and give your opinion.
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Climate change policies often conflict with economic interests. How do you think governments should balance environmental protection with economic growth?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: The rise of remote work has changed traditional office culture. Analyze the long-term implications of this shift on society and the economy.
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Social media platforms face criticism for their role in spreading misinformation. How should this issue be addressed while maintaining free speech?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

practiceSets.title: OPIc Advanced Mid - Advanced High - Cultural Analysis Practice 2

questions.prompt: How do cultural values influence people's approach to work and career success in different societies?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Analyze how immigration has shaped the cultural landscape of modern cities. What are the benefits and challenges?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Discuss the role of traditional festivals and celebrations in preserving cultural identity in a globalized world.
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: How has the concept of family structure evolved in recent decades, and what factors have driven these changes?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Examine the influence of Western culture on other parts of the world. Is this cultural exchange beneficial or problematic?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

practiceSets.title: OPIc Advanced Mid - Advanced High - Philosophical Questions Practice 3

questions.prompt: What defines a meaningful life? How do different people find purpose and fulfillment?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: Is it more important to focus on individual achievement or community well-being? Justify your perspective.
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: How do you think artificial intelligence and automation will change human society in the next 20 years?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: What is the relationship between happiness and success? Can someone be successful without being happy?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

questions.prompt: How should education systems adapt to prepare students for an rapidly changing world?
tips: Develop complex arguments with supporting evidence
Address multiple perspectives on the topic

mockTests.title: OPIc Practice Test 1 - Intermediate Low
mockTests.description: Complete OPIc simulation targeting Intermediate Low proficiency

questions: Please state your name and spell it for me.
Tell me what you do for work or study.
Describe the place where you live.

scenarios.setup: You're in a job interview and discussing salary and benefits. The interviewer represents the company.
scenarios.rolePlay: The salary offer is lower than expected, and the benefits package doesn't include some things you need. Negotiate professionally.
scenarios.followUp: The company can't increase the salary, but they're open to other benefits. What would you propose?

Work/Study: I am looking for a job
Hobbies & Interests: Exercising and going to the gym

Intermediate.setup: You're at a restaurant and there's a problem with your order. The server will help you.
Intermediate.rolePlay: Your food arrived cold and it's not what you ordered. Politely explain the problem and ask for a solution.
Intermediate.followUp: The manager offers you a discount, but you were hoping for a replacement meal. How do you respond?

Intermediate.setup: You've arrived at a hotel, but there's an issue with your reservation. Talk to the front desk clerk.
Intermediate.rolePlay: Your room isn't ready, but you need to shower and change for an important meeting. Explain your situation and find a solution.
Intermediate.followUp: The hotel is fully booked and can't provide another room. What alternatives would you suggest?

Intermediate.setup: You need to return an item to a store. The sales associate will help you.
Intermediate.rolePlay: You bought a shirt online, but it doesn't fit properly. You want to exchange it for a different size.
Intermediate.followUp: The shirt you want is out of stock in your size. How do you handle this situation?

Advanced.setup: You're in a job interview and discussing salary and benefits. The interviewer represents the company.
Advanced.rolePlay: The salary offer is lower than expected, and the benefits package doesn't include some things you need. Negotiate professionally.
Advanced.followUp: The company can't increase the salary, but they're open to other benefits. What would you propose?

Advanced.setup: You're presenting research at an academic conference. A colleague will ask challenging questions.
Advanced.rolePlay: Present your research findings and handle critical questions about your methodology and conclusions.
Advanced.followUp: Someone challenges the validity of your data collection method. How do you defend your approach?

Advanced.setup: You're leading a community meeting about a local development project. Residents have concerns.
Advanced.rolePlay: Address residents' concerns about noise, traffic, and environmental impact while explaining project benefits.
Advanced.followUp: The meeting is getting heated and people are interrupting each other. How do you maintain order and progress?
